dr.title: Command Line Interface
dr.description: Autoscrum will support a command line tool, which will be the primary interface for the user to interact with Autoscrum.

dr.title: Naming of the Autoscrum Master
dr.description: Autoscrum will allow the team the ability to name the Autoscrum Master.
Autoscrum will be able to handle two or more requests from different users simultaneously.

dr.title: Interactive Shell
dr.description: Autoscrum will support an interactive shell as part of the command line tool.

dr.title: Command Auto Completion
dr.description: Autoscrum will support command line auto-completion.

dr.title: Search Features
dr.description: Autoscrum will support advanced search features on the command line.

dr.title: Keyword Searches
dr.description: Autoscrum Search facilities will support keyword searches with the boolean operators 'and' and 'or'. Keyword search will be the default behavior of the search engine.

dr.title: Multiple Keyword Searches
dr.description: When multiple keywords are specified in the search, the default value will be to locate search results which contain all of the keywords, in any particular order.

dr.title: Keyword Search Case Sensitivity
dr.description: If the keywords contain only lowercase letters, Autoscrum will ignore case. Otherwise, searches will be case sensitive.

dr.title: Regex Searching
dr.description: Autoscrum will support regular expression (BRE, POSIX.2) based search features.

dr.title: Configuration - Regex Searching
dr.description: Autoscrum will support configuration to enable or disable regular expression based searches.

dr.title: Regex Format
dr.description: Autoscrum will distinguish regex based searches from keyword based searches by the format `re/regex/', where `regex' is a POSIX.2 compliant BRE regex.

dr.title: Command - Checkout
dr.description: Autoscrum will support a "checkout" command which will set one particular Scrum Object to be "active," meaning that any "update" commands won't need to be run with the fully qualified name of the Scrum Object.

dr.title: Command - List
dr.description: Autoscrum will have a "list" command, which lists the Scrum Objects that appear under the current (checked out) Object.

Autoscrum will support a filesystem-like naming scheme to specify fully qualified names of Scrum Objects. Shown below is the format used. /project/ |---epics/ |---|---stories/ |-------|---tasks/ |-------|---issues/

dr.title: Error Handling
dr.description: Autoscrum will support a dedicated Error handling module, whose only purpose will be to enforce graceful and verbose error handling.

Autoscrum will generate an error message in the case that the user issues a command to update a Scrum Object without specifying a fully qualified name and there is no currently checked out Scrum Object.

Autoscrum will support a configuration module, containing key/value pairs, which can be modified by the user. The purpose of this module will be to allow the user to tune their experience for performance and behavior, to provide a unique experience optimized for their own workflow.

dr.title: User Login and Logout
dr.description: Autoscrum will require users log in to use resources and services provided by Autoscrum.
Autoscrum will support integration with preexisting user information systems, such as openssl-passwd or LDAP.
Autoscrum will allow configuration of login/session behavior. This configuration will be accessible only to the owner of the Autoscrum executable.

dr.title: Usernames in Unicode
dr.description: Autoscrum users' registered Usernames will be stored in UTF-8, allowing characters not part of ASCII to appear in usernames.

dr.title: Login Sessions
dr.description: Autoscrum will support temporary "sessions"--a period of time where the user will not be asked to reauthenticate when they attempt a query to Autoscrum's resources or services.

dr.title: Session Length
dr.description: Autoscrum will support configuration of the length of time for which a valid session may exist, accessible only to the owner of the Autoscrum executable.

dr.title: Issues as Scrum Objects
dr.description: Autoscrum will support issues as objects for tracking the history of defects or problems with a project, as well as their resolution.

dr.title: Issue Traceability
dr.description: All issues must trace to a story in the project backlog. After an issue has been submitted, it is placed in a separate "unassigned issues" backlog, where it will remain until the Project Owner associates it with a story and assigns it to a Developer.

dr.title: Votes for Issues
dr.description: Autoscrum will support votes for Issues. Votes will increase the priority of the issue, moving it up in the backlog. Each registered Autoscrum user may vote only once for an issue, and all votes are created equal.
Autoscrum will support mirroring of issues submitted to any VCS (Versioning Control System) Hosting Service.
Autoscrum will support an interface for submitting issues by any recognized Autoscrum user.
Autoscrum will support an interface for closing issues, for the Project Owner and any Developer assigned to resolve the issue.
Autoscrum will support an interface for responding to issues, for the Project Owner and any Developer assigned to the issue.
Autoscrum will support an interface for assigning issues to members of the Development Team, for the Project Owner.

dr.title: Watchers for Issues
dr.description: Autoscrum will support "watchers" for issues. Watchers will be sent an email each time an update is made.

dr.title: Tasks as Scrum Objects
dr.description: Autoscrum will support tasks as a means for updating progress towards completing stories.

dr.title: Votes for Tasks
dr.description: Autoscrum will support votes for Tasks. Votes will increase the priority of the task, moving it up in the backlog. Each registered Autoscrum user may vote only once for an task, and all votes are created equal.

dr.title: Watchers for Tasks
dr.description: Autoscrum will support "watchers" for tasks. Watchers will be sent an email each time an update is made.
Autoscrum will support an interface for creating tasks for stories, for the Developer who was given the story to complete.
Autoscrum will support an interface for updating tasks, for the Developer who was assigned the task.
Autoscrum will support an interface deleting tasks, for the Developer who was given the story to complete.

dr.title: Stories as Scrum Objects
dr.description: Autoscrum will recognize Stories as Scrum Objects, according to The Scrum Guide.

dr.title: Votes for Stories
dr.description: Autoscrum will support votes for Stories. Votes will increase the priority of the story, moving it up in the backlog. Each registered Autoscrum user may vote only once for an story, and all votes are created equal.

dr.title: Watchers for Stories
dr.description: Autoscrum will support "watchers" for stories. Watchers will be sent an email each time an update is made.
Autoscrum will support an interface for creating stories, for the Project Owner.
Autoscrum will support an interface for updating stories, for the Project Owner and the Developer given the story to complete.
Autoscrum will support an interface for deleting stories, for the Project Owner.
Autoscrum will support "tags" for stories. Tags are static references which are used to categorize and prioritize stories.

dr.title: Backlogs as Scrum Objects
dr.description: Autoscrum will maintain a backlog containing stories.
Autoscrum will support both automatic and manual backlog maintenance.

Autoscrum will support automatic story prioritization in the backlog based on tags. Autoscrum will take as input an XML hierarchy of tag priority. For the example below, assume that tag1 is the parent of tag2, which is the parent of tag3 and tag4, and tag3 and tag4 are siblings. { Story: Example story Tags: tag1, tag3, tag4 Priority: f(l(tag1), l(tag3), l(tag4)) } In the example, f() is a function which returns the total priority of the story and l() is a function which returns the level of the tag (i.e. l(tag1) = 0, l(tag3) = 2, etc).

dr.title: Epics as Scrum Objects
dr.description: Autoscrum will support "Epics." Epics are user defined periods of time which contain a number of sprints, related in some way to be associated together in a meaningful way.

dr.title: Watchers for Epics
dr.description: Autoscrum will support "watchers" for epics. Watchers will be sent an email each time an update is made.

dr.title: Creating Epics
dr.description: Autoscrum will support an interface for creating Epics.

dr.title: Updating Epics
dr.description: Autoscrum will support an interface for updating Epics.

dr.title: Deleting Epics
dr.description: Autoscrum will support an interface for deleting Epics.

dr.title: Sprints as Scrum Objects
dr.description: Autoscrum will support Sprints, according to the Scrum Guide.
Autoscrum will allow configuration of sprint length.
Autoscrum will provide metrics to display the current user's contribution to the sprint goal.
Autoscrum will provide metrics to display the contribution of other users and the progress of the team. This printout will include to-do, in-progress, and completed stories.
Autoscrum will support creation of graphs and other images in PNG format for any metrics which may be represented in this fashion.
Autoscrum will support creation of a Sprint Goal, according to The Scrum Guide.
Autoscrum will support manual configuration of the sprint goal.

Autoscrum will support automatic configuration of the sprint goal based on the developer bids, backlog, and Neural Network prediction of performance. The purpose of these inputs is to allow Autoscrum to assign the Sprint Goal to maximize the efficiency of the Development Team.
Autoscrum will have a story bid submitting system which uses a modified Fibonacci sequence.
Autoscrum will assign stories to developers after they have submitted their time bids for the upcoming sprint, if automatic sprint planning is enabled.
Autoscrum will use a Neural Network to project team performance and to set the sprint goal.
Autoscrum will use email as the primary mode of communication and Scrum event facilitation.
Autoscrum will sign its name at the end of every email to the Development Team. This name is the name given to Autoscrum by the Development Team.
Autoscrum will allow configuration for the content of the email messages sent to the development team, for the Project Owner and Scrum Master.

Autoscrum will support configuration for sending out an email to all developers on the team at regular intervals, if the Project Owner so desires, containing the progress towards the sprint goal. This is how Autoscrum will facilitate the "Daily Scrum."
Autoscrum will allow configuration of the time interval that the "Daily Scrum" will occur.
Autoscrum will support configuration for sending an email to the Development Team at the end of the sprint period, if desired by the Project Owner. This email will facilitate the "Sprint Review."
Autoscrum will allow configuration for sending the Sprint Review to the Stakeholders, if desired by the Project Owner.
Autoscrum will support configuration for sending an email to the Development Team at the end of the sprint, if desired by the Project Owner, in order to facilitate the "Sprint Retrospective."

Autoscrum will support configuration for sending an email to the Development Team containing the Sprint Goal, if so desired by the Project Owner, when sprint planning is complete. This may be configured to occur regardless of whether automatic sprint planning is enabled.

dr.title: Projects as Scrum Objects
dr.description: Autoscrum will support Projects as top level objects in the ecosystem.

dr.title: Project Interface
dr.description: Autoscrum will support an interface for creating Projects, for any recognized Autoscrum user.
Autoscrum will support an interface for updating Projects, for the Project Owner.

Autoscrum will allow "private" projects--These projects will be protected by a project-global password. In addition, recognized Autoscrum users must be invited by the Project Owner to view the project's resources.
Autoscrum will make all Projects "public" by default.
Autoscrum will support an interface for deleting Projects, for the Project Owner.
Autoscrum will have the capability to point to released versions of the product.

Autoscrum will support Scrum roles for users, which will change the user experience--this will affect user permissions and responsibilities. Roles supported by Autoscrum include, but are not limited to: * Project Owner * Scrum Master * Developer
Autoscrum will not allow a Project to exist without administration by a registered Project Owner who is a recognized Autoscrum user.

Autoscrum will be able to produce a comprehensive history of a Project maintained by Autoscrum. The purpose of this is to create a log which can be used (by an uninformed party, for example) to follow the evolution of a product from inception.
